Finally, as result of the analysis, we decided to update a platform setting (or create a new one for the cloud nodes). devdoc.author: develop@teller.finance
devdoc.details: The platform settings functions (create, update, and remove) don't include the whenNotPaused() modifier because we might need to use them in both cases (when the platform is paused and not paused). Example: - There is a potential issue and before analyzing it, we pause the platform to avoid funds losses. Finally, as result of the analysis, we decided to update a platform setting (or create a new one for the cloud nodes). In this scenario, if the modifier is present, we couldn't update the setting (because the platform is paused).

params.assetAddress: asset address used to create the new setting.
params.cTokenAddress: cToken address used to configure the asset setting.
params.maxLoanAmount: the max loan amount used to configure the asset setting.

createComponentVersion(bytes32,uint32).details: We will allow Node components to be created while the Settings contract is paused, as this could be needed to unpause the contract.

params.componentName: name of the component to be added.

params.maxValue: the max value for the setting.
params.minValue: the min value for the setting.
params.value: the initial value for the given setting name.

params.assetAddress: asset address to test the setting.

exceedsMaxLoanAmount(address,uint256).return: true if amount exceeds current max loan amout. Otherwise it returns false.

params.assetAddress: asset address used to get the current settings.

params.componentName: name of the component to return the version.

getComponentVersion(bytes32).return: version of the node component if exists or zero 0 if not found.

hasPauserRole(address).return: true if account has the pauser role. Otherwise it returns false.

hasPlatformSetting(bytes32).return: true if the setting is already configured. Otherwise it returns false.

isPaused().return: true if platform is paused. Otherwise it returns false.

pause().details: Called by a pauser to pause, triggers stopped state.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.assetAddress: asset address used to remove the asset settings.

removeComponentVersion(bytes32).details: We will allow Node components to be removed while the Settings contract is paused, as this could be needed to unpause the contract.

params.componentName: name of the component to be removed.

unpause().details: Called by a pauser to unpause, returns to normal state.

params.newCTokenAddress: the new cToken address to configure.

updateComponentVersion(bytes32,uint32).details: We will allow Node components to be updated while the Settings contract is paused, as this could be needed to unpause the contract.

params.componentName: name of the component to be modified.

params.newMaxLoanAmount: the new maximum loan amount to configure.

createAssetSettings(address,address,uint.notice: It creates a new asset settings in the platform.

createComponentVersion(bytes32,uint32).notice: Add a new Node Component with its version.

createPlatformSetting(bytes32,uint256,ui.notice: It creates a new platform setting given a setting name, value, min and max values.

exceedsMaxLoanAmount(address,uint256).notice: Tests whether amount exceeds the current maximum loan amount for a specific asset settings.

getAssetSettings(address).notice: Get the current asset settings for a given asset address.

getAssets().notice: Gets the current asset addresses list.

getComponentVersion(bytes32).notice: Get the version of a specific node component.

getPlatformSetting(bytes32).notice: It gets the current platform setting for a given setting name

getPlatformSettingValue(bytes32).notice: It gets the current platform setting value for a given setting name

hasPauserRole(address).notice: Tests whether an account has the pauser role.

hasPlatformSetting(bytes32).notice: It tests whether a setting name is already configured.

isPaused().notice: It gets whether the platform is paused or not.

pauseLendingPool(address).notice: It pauses a specific lending pool.

removeAssetSettings(address).notice: It removes all the asset settings for a specific asset address.

removeComponentVersion(bytes32).notice: Remove a Node Component from the list.

removePlatformSetting(bytes32).notice: Removes a current platform setting given a setting name.

unpauseLendingPool(address).notice: It unpauses a specific lending pool.

updateCTokenAddress(address,address).notice: It updates the cToken address for a specific asset address.

updateComponentVersion(bytes32,uint32).notice: Set a new version for a Node Component.

updateMaxLoanAmount(address,uint256).notice: It updates the maximum loan amount for a specific asset address.

updatePlatformSetting(bytes32,uint256).notice: It updates an existent platform setting given a setting name.It only allows to update the value (not the min or max values).In case you need to update the min or max values, you need to remove it, and create it again.

userdoc.notice: This contract manages the configuration of the platform.
